==Dialogue==
{{Dialogue Start}}
:'''Haloa Nui:''' Hello there! I just knew that great music would attract great listeners!
:{{DIcon}} Is that a compliment?
::'''Haloa Nui:''' That's okay! We've got a big group already, so it won't be a problem for you to join us.
::'''Haloa Nui:''' Have you already met anyone else from the Nui family? They're all my relatives!
::'''Haloa Nui:''' If you haven't met any of them yet, that could only mean that you've only just got here, and haven't learned too much about our tribe's way of life.
::'''Haloa Nui:''' If you need help with anything, just ask! One of us is bound to be able to help you.
:{{DIcon}} You complimenting yourself over there?
::'''Haloa Nui:''' Ooh, you've got a good eye.
::'''Haloa Nui:''' Well, since that's the case, let me give you a helpful tip!
::'''Haloa Nui:''' Go find a guy called [[Wakea Nui]]. He'll show you all the fun places in the tribe!
:{{DIcon}} See you.
::'''Haloa Nui:''' Until next time!
{{Dialogue End}}

==Trivia==
===Etymology===
* The name may be a reference to {{w|Hāloa}}, a figure in Hawaiian mythology who was born of Hawaiian gods and is said to be the ancestors of the Hawaiian people. The word {{wt|nui}}  means "great" or "big" in many Polynesian languages.
